text:
I have a Dual Xeon EM64T, when i try to run the "configure" script for the jsvc
it fails saying the cpu architecture is not supported.
I have inserted a line in the configure file to add support for x86_64, i don't
know if i did it well but at least it compiles and seems to work fine...

in the case block (around 2630 line) insert the following code
  x86_64)
    CFLAGS="$CFLAGS -DCPU=\\\"i686\\\"" ;;


please add support for the architecture listed above.
thank you guys.
ciao paolo
creator: p_spadafora@virgilio.it

text:
Whic configure script did you have in mind?  There are four in the
jakarta-tomcat-connectors module: one for JK, one for JK2, one for native JNI,
and one for the mod_webapp connector.  None of them have close to 2630 lines...
creator: yoavs@computer.org
william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Whic configure script did you have in mind?  There are four in the
> jakarta-tomcat-connectors module: one for JK, one for JK2, one for native 
JNI,
> and one for the mod_webapp connector.  None of them have close to 2630 
lines...

Urm, the one in commons-daemon/src/native/unix

(In reply to comment #1)
> Whic configure script did you have in mind?  There are four in the
> jakarta-tomcat-connectors module: one for JK, one for JK2, one for native JNI,
> and one for the mod_webapp connector.  None of them have close to 2630 lines...

the one to run tomcat as service under linux, in the jsvc-src directory.
creator: p_spadafora@virgilio.it

myself.  A little help here please ;-).
